entities.name: sunlight
entities.description: Sunlight, also known as sunshine, is the light and energy emitted by the Sun. It plays a crucial role in various natural processes on Earth.

entities.name: storms
entities.description: Intense weather events characterized by strong winds and heavy precipitation.

entities.name: Global Challenges
entities.description: Global challenges are large-scale problems that affect the entire world, such as climate change, poverty, and health issues.

entities.name: disaster management
entities.description: Disaster management involves planning and coordinating efforts to mitigate the impact of natural disasters.

entities.name: Data Transmission Rates
entities.description: Data transmission rates refer to the speed at which data can be transferred between different points.

entities.name: Life
entities.description: Life on Earth is diverse and includes a wide range of organisms from microorganisms to complex multicellular life forms.

entities.name: future of satellite technology
entities.description: Promising progress in miniaturization, propulsion, and communication systems enhancing satellite capabilities and affordability.

entities.name: electricity
entities.description: Electricity is a form of energy that results from the movement of charged particles, such as electrons. It is widely used to power various devices and systems.

attributes.Usage: Operating Satellite Systems and Charging Batteries

entities.name: Communication
entities.description: The process of exchanging information between two or more entities.

entities.name: Advancements in Communication Systems
entities.description: Advancements in communication systems have enhanced the capabilities of satellites, allowing startups to develop more sophisticated applications and services.

entities.name: Sun
entities.description: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System, providing light and energy to Earth.

entities.name: STARTUPS

entities.name: Traditional Infrastructure
entities.description: Traditional infrastructure includes roads, electricity, water supply, and communication networks.

entities.name: remote and rural areas
entities.description: Remote and rural areas are regions that are far from urban centers, often characterized by low population density and limited access to infrastructure.

entities.name: Atmosphere
entities.description: The atmosphere of Earth is a layer of gases surrounding the planet, composed primarily of nitrogen and oxygen.

entities.name: public safety
entities.description: Public safety involves protecting the health, safety, and welfare of the public.

entities.name: Coastal Areas
entities.description: Coastal areas are regions near the sea that are often affected by tsunamis due to their proximity to the ocean.

entities.name: Oceans
entities.description: The oceans cover about 71% of Earth"s surface and play a crucial role in the planet"s climate and weather patterns.

entities.name: Land Cover
entities.description: The land cover of Earth includes a variety of landscapes such as forests, deserts, mountains, and plains.

entities.name: Satellite Speed
entities.description: The velocity at which a satellite travels in space, which must be balanced with gravity to maintain a stable orbit.

entities.name: EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS

entities.name: DEVELOPING COUNTRIES
entities.description: Nations that benefit from the reduced costs and increased accessibility of CubeSats

entities.name: Batteries
entities.description: Batteries store electrical energy and provide power when needed, especially in situations where a continuous supply of electricity is not available.

entities.name: Navigation
entities.description: The process of monitoring and controlling the movement of a craft or vehicle from one place to another.

entities.name: cameras
entities.description: Cameras are devices used to capture images or videos. In the context of satellites, they are equipped on weather satellites to monitor Earth"s weather patterns and provide valuable data for meteorologists.

entities.name: global connectivity
entities.description: Global connectivity refers to the ability to connect and communicate across different parts of the world, often facilitated by technology such as satellites.

attributes.Importance: Indispensable for various fields including telecommunications, weather forecasting, scientific research, and national security.
attributes.Benefit: Enables communication across continents, especially in remote and rural areas where traditional infrastructure is lacking.

entities.name: technology
entities.description: Technology refers to the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, including the development and use of tools, machines, systems, or methods. In the context of satellites, technology encompasses various advancements that have transformed communication, navigation, data gathering, and planetary monitoring.

entities.name: Satellite Escape
entities.description: The phenomenon where a satellite moves away from its orbit and escapes into space.

entities.name: National Security
entities.description: National security involves protecting a nation from external threats.

entities.name: costs
entities.description: Decrease in financial expenses associated with satellite production and launch.

entities.name: RADIO SIGNALS
entities.description: Signals used to communicate with satellites from Earth stations

entities.name: BUS
entities.description: The structure of a satellite that houses the payload and provides power, communication, and control systems

entities.name: physics
entities.description: Physics is the natural science that studies matter, its motion and behavior through space and time, and the related entities of energy and force.

attributes.Applications: Telecommunications, weather forecasting, scientific research, national security

entities.name: Monitoring Weather Patterns
entities.description: The process of observing and recording atmospheric conditions over time.

entities.name: Innovation
entities.description: Innovation refers to the introduction of new ideas, methods, or products that bring about significant changes and improvements.

entities.name: More Reliable Communication
entities.description: Reliable communication methods ensure that data is transmitted accurately and consistently.

entities.name: tsunamis
entities.description: Tsunamis are large ocean waves caused by underwater earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, landslides, or meteor impacts.

entities.name: equator
entities.description: The equator is an imaginary line around the Earth, dividing it into the Northern and Southern Hemispheres. It is located at 0 degrees latitude.

entities.name: Faster Communication
entities.description: Faster communication methods allow for quicker and more efficient exchange of information.

entities.name: Space Exploration
entities.description: The discovery and exploration of outer space using spacecraft.

entities.name: propulsion
entities.description: Efficient space maneuvering and extended operational lifetimes.

entities.name: laws of motion
entities.description: The laws of motion are fundamental principles in physics that describe the relationship between a body and the forces acting upon it, and its motion in response to those forces.

entities.name: PAYLOAD
entities.description: The equipment or instruments on a satellite that perform its primary function

entities.name: Data Gathering
entities.description: The process of collecting and measuring information on variables of interest.

entities.name: Meteorologists
entities.description: Scientists who study the atmosphere and weather phenomena.

entities.name: Providing Data for Meteorologists
entities.description: Meteorologists use the data collected by sensors to make accurate weather predictions and issue timely warnings.

entities.name: Conservation Efforts
entities.description: Efforts aimed at protecting and preserving natural resources and ecosystems.
